verses.kjv: In the second year of Joash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel reigned Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah.
verses.ct: Amaziah son of Joash became king of Judah during the 2nd year of King Joash son of Jehoahaz of Israel.

verses.kjv: He was twenty and five years old when he began to reign, and reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Jehoaddan of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: He was 25 years old when he took the throne, and he ruled for 29 years in Jerusalem. His mother was Jehoaddan, from Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, yet not like David his father: he did according to all things as Joash his father did.
verses.ct: He did what was right in the LORD's judgment, though not to the degree that his ancestor David had. He followed the example of his father Joash in everything.

verses.kjv: Howbeit the high places were not taken away: as yet the people did sacrifice and burnt incense on the high places.
verses.ct: Still, the hilltop shrines were not removed. The people continued offering sacrifices and burning incense at those places.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as soon as the kingdom was confirmed in his hand, that he slew his servants which had slain the king his father.
verses.ct: Once his grip on the kingdom was secure, he executed the officials who had killed his father the king.

verses.kjv: But the children of the murderers he slew not: according unto that which is written in the book of the law of Moses, wherein the LORD commanded, saying, The fathers shall not be put to death for the children, nor the children be put to death for the fathers; but every man shall be put to death for his own sin.
verses.ct: However, he did not kill the children of the assassins. He followed what is written in the Book of the Law of Moses, where the LORD gave this command: "Parents must not be executed for their children's sins, and children must not be executed for their parents' sins. Each person must be put to death only for their own sin."

verses.kjv: He slew of Edom in the valley of salt ten thousand, and took Selah by war, and called the name of it Joktheel unto this day.
verses.ct: He defeated 10,000 Edomites in the Valley of Salt and captured the city of Selah in battle, renaming it Joktheel — a name it still carries today.

verses.kjv: Then Amaziah sent messengers to Jehoash, the son of Jehoahaz son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying, Come, let us look one another in the face.
verses.ct: After that, Amaziah sent messengers to King Jehoash of Israel, the son of Jehoahaz and grandson of Jehu, with this challenge: "Come, let's meet each other in battle."

verses.kjv: And Jehoash the king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah, saying, The thistle that was in Lebanon sent to the cedar that was in Lebanon, saying, Give thy daughter to my son to wife: and there passed by a wild beast that was in Lebanon, and trode down the thistle.
verses.ct: King Jehoash of Israel sent this reply to King Amaziah of Judah: "A thornbush in Lebanon once sent a message to a cedar tree in Lebanon, saying, 'Give your daughter in marriage to my son.' But then a wild animal from Lebanon came along and trampled the thornbush.

verses.kjv: Thou hast indeed smitten Edom, and thine heart hath lifted thee up: glory of this, and tarry at home: for why shouldest thou meddle to thy hurt, that thou shouldest fall, even thou, and Judah with thee?
verses.ct: "Sure, you've defeated Edom, and now you're full of pride. Enjoy your glory and stay home! Why stir up trouble that will bring disaster on yourself and drag Judah down with you?"

verses.kjv: But Amaziah would not hear. Therefore Jehoash king of Israel went up; and he and Amaziah king of Judah looked one another in the face at Bethshemesh, which belongeth to Judah.
verses.ct: But Amaziah refused to listen. So King Jehoash of Israel marched out, and he and King Amaziah of Judah faced each other in battle at Beth-shemesh, a town in Judah.

verses.kjv: And Judah was put to the worse before Israel; and they fled every man to their tents.
verses.ct: Judah was defeated by Israel, and every soldier scattered and fled to their homes.

verses.kjv: And Jehoash king of Israel took Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Jehoash the son of Ahaziah, at Bethshemesh, and came to Jerusalem, and brake down the wall of Jerusalem from the gate of Ephraim unto the corner gate, four hundred cubits.
verses.ct: King Jehoash of Israel captured King Amaziah of Judah, the son of Jehoash and grandson of Ahaziah, at Beth-shemesh. Then Jehoash marched to Jerusalem and tore down a section of the city wall stretching from the Ephraim Gate to the Corner Gate — about 600 feet.

verses.kjv: And he took all the gold and silver, and all the vessels that were found in the house of the LORD, and in the treasures of the king’s house, and hostages, and returned to Samaria.
verses.ct: He seized all the gold and silver and every item found in the LORD's temple and in the royal treasury. He also took hostages and then returned to Samaria.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoash which he did, and his might, and how he fought with Amaziah king of Judah, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else that Jehoash accomplished, including his military power and his war against King Amaziah of Judah, is recorded in the official chronicles of the kings of Israel.

verses.kjv: And Jehoash slept with his fathers, and was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel; and Jeroboam his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Jehoash died and was buried in Samaria alongside the kings of Israel. His son Jeroboam succeeded him as king.

verses.kjv: And Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah lived after the death of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel fifteen years.
verses.ct: King Amaziah of Judah, son of Joash, survived for 15 years after the death of King Jehoash of Israel, son of Jehoahaz.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Amaziah, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.ct: Everything else Amaziah did is recorded in the official chronicles of the kings of Judah.

verses.kjv: Now they made a conspiracy against him in Jerusalem: and he fled to Lachish; but they sent after him to Lachish, and slew him there.
verses.ct: A conspiracy was formed against him in Jerusalem, so he escaped to Lachish. But the conspirators sent men after him to Lachish and killed him there.

verses.kjv: And they brought him on horses: and he was buried at Jerusalem with his fathers in the city of David.
verses.ct: His body was brought back on horses and buried in Jerusalem with his ancestors in the City of David.

verses.kjv: And all the people of Judah took Azariah, which was sixteen years old, and made him king instead of his father Amaziah.
verses.ct: Then all the people of Judah chose Azariah, who was 16 years old, and crowned him king in place of his father Amaziah.

verses.kjv: He built Elath, and restored it to Judah, after that the king slept with his fathers.
verses.ct: He rebuilt Elath and brought it back under Judah's control after the king had died.

verses.kjv: In the fifteenth year of Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel began to reign in Samaria, and reigned forty and one years.
verses.ct: During the 15th year of King Amaziah of Judah, son of Joash, Jeroboam son of Joash became king of Israel in Samaria. He ruled for 41 years.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD: he departed not from all the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin.
verses.ct: He did what was evil in the LORD's judgment. He never turned away from any of the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had led Israel into.

verses.kjv: He restored the coast of Israel from the entering of Hamath unto the sea of the plain, according to the word of the LORD God of Israel, which he spake by the hand of his servant Jonah, the son of Amittai, the prophet, which was of Gathhepher.
verses.ct: He reclaimed Israel's territory from Lebo-hamath all the way to the Dead Sea, fulfilling the message the LORD, the God of Israel, had spoken through his servant Jonah son of Amittai, the prophet from Gath-hepher.

verses.kjv: For the LORD saw the affliction of Israel, that it was very bitter: for there was not any shut up, nor any left, nor any helper for Israel.
verses.ct: The LORD had seen how severely Israel was suffering. No one was left — whether slave or free — and there was no one to help Israel.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said not that he would blot out the name of Israel from under heaven: but he saved them by the hand of Jeroboam the son of Joash.
verses.ct: The LORD had not declared that he would erase Israel's name from under heaven, so he rescued them through Jeroboam son of Joash.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, and all that he did, and his might, how he warred, and how he recovered Damascus, and Hamath, which belonged to Judah, for Israel, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else Jeroboam accomplished — all his actions, his military strength, his wars, and how he recaptured Damascus and Hamath (which had belonged to Judah) for Israel — is recorded in the official chronicles of the kings of Israel.

verses.kjv: And Jeroboam slept with his fathers, even with the kings of Israel; and Zachariah his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Jeroboam died and joined the kings of Israel who came before him. His son Zachariah succeeded him as king.
